title: How to Make a Smoke Bomb from Potassium Nitrate and Sugar

steps.title: Measure 60 grams potassium nitrate and 40 grams (1.4 oz) of sugar.
steps.content: Measure 60 grams potassium nitrate and 40 grams (1.4 oz) of sugar. If you don't have any weighing scales, don't worry, the ratio is 3 parts of potassium nitrate to 2 parts sugar, so you can just use a tablespoon or use the small spoons found in baby formula milk (e.g. Cow and Gate, Optamil).

steps.title: Get a pan, preferably non-stick, and put in your potassium nitrate and sugar.
steps.content: Get a pan, preferably non-stick, and put in your potassium nitrate and sugar. Put the heat on as low as it will go. This prevents any unwanted accidents from happening. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Stir continuously, but not vigorously, to prevent the material from burning.
steps.content: Stir continuously, but not vigorously, to prevent the material from burning. After about 10 minutes, you will notice that the powder starts to flow a bit like water. This happens because the sugar is caramelizing.

steps.title: Wait for the sugar to caramelize.
steps.content: Wait for the sugar to caramelize. After few minutes, brown lumps will start to appear. After another few minutes, the whole mixture will turn brown and will go all soggy,a bit like peanut butter. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Take the mixture off the stove and pour it onto foil or into a cardboard tube.
steps.content: Take the mixture off the stove and pour it onto foil or into a cardboard tube. It is really important that you take it off when it looks like peanut butter, otherwise it will turn chocolate-y, and eventually start to burn. [3] X Research source To make a tube for your smoke bomb, just get a toilet paper tube and tape the bottom using electrical tape or duct tape. Clean your pan. A good thing to do would be to get a lighter and set any remaining bits on fire to make sure that the batch will work.

steps.title: Once the tube is full, insert a fuse.
steps.content: Once the tube is full, insert a fuse. If you don't have a fuse, no problem, the mixture is flammable so you can light it directly.

steps.title: Cover the whole thing in either electrical tape or duct tape.
steps.content: Cover the whole thing in either electrical tape or duct tape. Make sure to leave a small hole where the fuse sticks out

steps.title: Make about 2-4 holes.
steps.content: Make about 2-4 holes. This step is optional, but doing this will allow any pressure that might build up to escape. And that's itâ€”go outside and enjoy!
